result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of the Plea Hearing held before the Honorable R. Michael Waterman on September 29th, 2015 filed by Reporter E. Drost. gme
of the MH held before the Honorable R. Michael Waterman on May 19, 2016 filed by Reporter E. Drost. gme

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Benoy    9:48  ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail.   INCLUDES 15CM480, 15CM477, 15CM281 & 15CM214.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM214, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 1 in 15CM477.   DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM477, Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM281 and Guilty to Count 1 in 15CM477.   On motion of the State, Crt reads in for restitution purposes and dismisses 15CM480.  Court dismisses Cts 2 & 3 in 15CM281. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

15CM214: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM281: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200

15CM477: S/W 2 years probation, concurrent
-Court costs $243
-DNA surcharge $200
- 46 days credit

Probation conditions:
-complete all evalutaions recommended by probation agent and follow though with all therapy & treatment
- restitution $550; joint and several with Robert Carroll (15CM498)
   DF has 10 days to verify restitution amount and file objection

Bond continues until DF signs up for probation

DF to meet with payment clerk after release

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail.  Court called at 1:32 p.m.  Includes case 15CM477 & 15CM480.  ADA Nieskes advises the court a global resolution was offered to the DE and the  2 cases pending in Branch 4 have now been set for trial.  Court will set 15CM477 for a Jury Trial.  Motions in Limine will be heard at 8:00 a.m. on day of trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m. lw  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Case called 11:29  Includes 15CM214, 15CM281, 15CM477, 15CM480. ADA Nieskes updates Court, a resolution has yet been reached. Atty. Harrelson updates Court. Bail continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 4:22 pm. Includes 15CM477 and 15CM480. Atty. Harrelson updates Court. ADA Nieskes makes argument regarding bond. Court continues bail as previously ordered. Court requests 15CM281 and 15CM241 brought in with branch 1. Adjourned 4:28 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:15 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Heidi J. Mangelsen for Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Brian Francis Anderson appeared.  Court called at 3:18 p.m. Includes case 15CM477 & 15CM480.  Attorney Mangelsen argues bond.  DE has the opportunity to get into a treatment facility.  DE makes statement.  State objects.  Court will consider a co-signature bond.  Set out for BBH.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:25 p.m. lw  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
and Motion for Review of Bail/Bond. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
Filed by Atty Harrelson. Re: PTC on 8/26/2015. km

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Brian Francis Anderson appeared from jail. Includes 15CM477, 15CM480 (Init), 15CM214 & 15CM281(RW).   QUASH WARRANTS.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on 15CM477.  Request speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

INCLUDES 15CM477 & 15CM480

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Christy C. or Shannon S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
